title: Research-Practice Partnership (RPP) Boundary Expansion Strategy

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of educational policies and collaborative project management
context.additional_context: Learners, as ordinary citizens, analyze collaborative cases between educational fields and research institutions, and develop reflective thinking skills regarding boundary-crossing roles. Flexible learning is facilitated through microlearning modules and discussion forums using personal devices

learning_goals: Through comparative case analysis, learners can describe the characteristics of individuals who perform boundary-spanning roles in RPP (Research-Practice Partnerships) across five dimensions, such as institutional focus and task orientation.
Learners can assess the impact of power dynamics on partnerships through reflective analysis and propose effective collaboration strategies.
Learners can design boundary-spanning strategies considering organizational and cultural contexts and derive improvement plans by applying them to real-world cases.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
